<question>



A friend of mine finally knows how i feel, what do you think?



A friend of mine finally knows how i feel, what do you think?
a so-called friend of mine who i thought i could trust, revealed to a friend who i'm in love with, the feelings i hid from her. Last week i tried avoiding contact with her because jealousy over took my entire mind(long story). She doesn't know this though. For 2 days i had the time to take my mind off of things and keep myself productive. But just when I thought it was all going well, the following day my friend tells me that he speaks with her and tells her everything about my feelings for her. He got so sick of seeing me so down and sad that he had to go up to her and have a 1on1 chat about it. She doesn't even know him. I got so upset after hearing what he did. We argued for an hour straight. I gave up and completely lost focus on everything. The fact that I am bi-sexual makes things even harder to communicate with others about my personal problems. I felt so pressured at this point that I opened up to my brother about my sexuality. It's a long story. However, surprisingly he supported me which brought tears to my eyes. To make a long story shorter, i spoke with the friend i'm in love with, explaining to her what really happened and why this all happened. I didn't want her to believe what this guy told her and the good thing about her is that she always trusts me no matter what. We had several conversations about 'these feelings' i have. And at first she wasn't sure but when she asked me if i was in love with her i paused and never really directly responded back to her question. she apologized and told me that she had a feeling that was the reason for all this and that she was too nervous to ask me. she begged me to answer her, telling me not to feel so sad, and how her heart was going crazy too. It took a while for me to respond back and before i could do so, she had to leave. the next time we talk i apologize for not responding. Then we continued on where we left off. She asks me all these questions of how i look at things regarding my 'orientation'. Her initial response towards my reaction was that she thought i looked at 'these feelings' as a bad thing. In this case, I reassured her. She said "I know that our love exists the way it does already."Then she tells me that she wishes we could share our love more but doesn't know of a way to express them with each other and if i came up with a way to let her know. Now my question is, the way she approached this, made it seem as if she feels the same way for me. Do you think she should be saying this if she didn't feel the same way? I mean we're both females. I know that we're both interested in women also. so should i tell her directly how i feel? do you think she'd even want to hear it?



</question>

<answer>



It's good to seriously contemplate trying everything once, otherwise you'll never know whether you understood it well enough to have wanted to do it (if that makes sense!).



If something floats your boat, go for it and give it a go. But do it safely and with the right people / person / equipment (//ahem!//).



Best to leave the really extreme stuff to others until you've experienced the not-so-extreme stuff and are really switched on to it and build up from there.



That goes for everything, from curries and surfing to parachuting and on to er... "intimate relations".



Enjoy it - whatever you try  ;o)



</answer>

<answer from>



Bret
Member since: 22 April 2008
Total points: 3025 (Level 4)



</answer from>



<answer>



Baby Boy, you made the decision to have a monogamous relationship with her, a woman. Sometimes we have to look at what really matters in our lives and our deepest selves.  What is more important to you: loving and being loved in a good committed relationship or throwing that all away by having an "affair" with another man? You don't mention your age, but that "sexuality" thing will wan as you get older.  So, what is important to you right this moment?  If the desire to explore and play with your gay side, porn and fantasy may be enough.  Buy your girlfriend a strap-on and tell her what you'd like her to do with it.  But if she knows how you really feel about her, that you're faithful to her, then anything you may do with someone else, whether another dude or a woman, is going to hurt her and you know it.  So, either stand by her as you love her, or break up with her and start exploring your wild side.  However, don't let this go on.  If you're miserable (and not just frustrated), then play with some gay porn when you're alone.  These things have a tendency to work themselves out, but just be careful with her heart and your own.  Best of luck to you.



</answer>

<question>



What is a 60 yr old working man likely to get in the UK?



concerning free prescriptions, bus pass etc.
Is it automatic or does it have to be applied for??



</question>



<answer from>



Empress
Member since: 17 July 2006
Total points: 8972 (Level 5)



</answer from>



<answer>



the retirement age is 65 for a man not 60



</answer>



<answer from>



paintedt...
Member since: 07 April 2006
Total points: 3075 (Level 4)



</answer from>



<answer>



At 60 he gets a free bus pass he needs to go to the Post Office to enquire about this. He will also get free prescriptions, I think as long as he is a British Citizen and has the necessary documentation to prove he is, he wont need to apply for free prescriptions it should be automatic. That's how it was for my mum and dad.



Empress you need to read the question properly, they never ask about retirement. In the UK people get special privileges  by default when they turn 60 regardless of whether they have retired or not. :/



</answer>



<answer from>



AndyUK
Member since: 04 May 2008
Total points: 222 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



Free prescriptions are automatic in the UK for anyone male or female
60 or over in the UK, if their income is low they can apply for
pension credit, again at 60 or over, a bus pass has to be
applied for.



</answer>



<answer from>



Catherine H
Member since: 30 March 2007
Total points: 297 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



If he`s rich he`ll get a 35 year old girl no matter what he looks like



</answer>



<answer from>



CC
Member since: 30 November 2007
Total points: 3411 (Level 4)



</answer from>



<answer>



He will be entitled to free prescriptions - Automatic



A winter fuel allowance - £250 this year I think this has to be applied for
Free bus pass - has to be applied for
Free swimming sessions - from April 09. not sure about this yet. If anyone in the house is over 60 and on certain benefits they also qualifiy for a grant of up to £2,700 for house insulation.  New boiler, cavity wall insulation, loft insulation.
this has to be applied for.
Its worth looking into all this properly or you may miss
out, because no one actually tells you what you are entitled
to.



</answer>

<answer>



Well, I'm assuming the land alone is worth far more than a couple of bucks.  I'm not familiar with the area, but it looks pretty depressed, and the abandoned home comes probably comes with a host of problems. She'll owe $850 for back taxes, and have to pay to have the yard cleaned (several thousand dollars). After being abandoned for so long, it's probably best to simply tear the thing down, again, several thousand dollars. She said she's going to sell it, but obviously, nobody wanted it to begin with (it was in foreclosure, and no doubt the bank tired to sell it before). I don't know if she really won anything, other than a pain in the butt. She'll have to pay taxes on it until she sells it, and if someone breaks their leg (etc) on her property, they can sue, and she'll be responsible. When winter comes, she could be fined for not clearing the walks each time it snows (or pay a service to do it when it does snow)... Also, that was Michigan, not Washington..

She may be happy to sell it to someone else for $1.75.



On the brightside, maybe she can start a late-night informercial on buying properties for "less than" a Starbucks coffee, and then she can make some real money.

<question>



I agree with banning these spelling tests, do you?



and here's my reason why. Years ago (60's) 7 year olds were subjected to these tests every Friday. The results were read out and the smarty pants were all issued with gold stars, sweets, and tempting goodies. Now the majority who "failed" were given the harsh treatment, no playtime for a week, write out the badly spelt words many times, and the eventual 2nd chance test the following week. Now my experience of this whole palaver was not of joy. Many's a night my mother must have been praying for a miracle as she put me through this spelling ritual. However i was a child of average ability, got there in the end, but feel for the kids who even got the cane for messing up their spellings. Anyone want to share their experiences?



</question>



<answer from>

Member since: 28 August 2008
Total points: 1050 (Level 3)

First, congrats on the new love! I think telling people is your choice, to be honest its nobody's business except who you want it to be, so I would only tell those who ask, this will help prevent you and your girlfriend dealing with people who would try to use your relationship status against you. Be honest, but tell only those you trust, at least now. I hope this helps you, and I hope you and your girlfriend have a wonderful, long healthy relationship!



</answer>



<answer from>



Stargaze...
Member since: 04 March 2008
Total points: 1482 (Level 3)



</answer from>



<answer>



you do not have to tell anyone , unless you feel like it



</answer>

<question>



Why do some adults complain about kids and act like they were born being 30?



Kids these days have it so easy



They get away with everything



They can't get beat by there parents anymore.



Sounds like jealousy.



</question>



<answer from>



Mike K
Member since: 30 November 2007
Total points: 18926 (Level 6)



Contributing In:



Religion & Spirituality



Other - Society & Culture



</answer from>



<answer>



<evaluation>Best Answer - Chosen by Asker</evaluation>



Hello,



1) Sometimes the adults that are having the kids are not nearly as smart as some of the children. They're too busy keeping up with the Jones and don't dedicate enough time to rear the children.



In some ways they have it easier and in other ways they do not.



2) Some get away with things to a point but if the parents don't teach them, eventually society will. In my young days the worst that would happen was your peers or those you wronged would give you a healthy punch in the mouth or a kick in the fork. Today there are a lot more guns and knives being used and mistakes can be fatal.



3) In my country corporal punishment has gone to the supreme court already. Parents are still allowed to use reasonable force like spankings on children but they can't beat them with sticks, break teeth or bones etc.



4) In quite a few cases I have seen it is not good and bad children but good and bad parents that seem to make the differences.



Cheers,



Michael Kelly



Source(s):



Born in the early 50's; seen many changes and remember that Father Knows Best era.



</answer>

<answer>

</question from>



<question>



Goth/Punk/Alternative Fashions. Only for the rich?



It seems that plenty of stores that offer clothes and acessories of these fashions are really over-priced despite their popularity and likelihood of being bought. There are even cotton t-shirts over 50£ in quite a few stores that boast these styles. Should I, a total plebeian, just give up thinking that I can be what I want to be on the outside? Is every store like this? How is it on the other points of the world?



</question>



<answer from>



kor0va_m...
Member since: 30 June 2008
Total points: 798 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



i think your just looking in the worng stores- try the internet



</answer>



<answer from>



Bronwyn E
Member since: 31 March 2008
Total points: 797 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



In the  70's Punk was about rebellion against the fascist rich.



Torn t-shirts and ripped jeans held together with safety pins and second hand clothing was a statement..... 'we can't afford your fashion so we will make up our own'.
Then the fashion industry cashed in and it became fashionable to have safety pins and rips in your clothing...punk fashion failed when it became trendy. Wearing expensive punk clothing really defeats the purpose of being punk.



If you really want to rebel buy all your clothing at second hand stores. I would love to see young people once again sticking it up the overpriced fashion industry and only buying pre-loved goods. Not only do you save money but if you buy from charity shops you are also supporting a good cause.



Pleb wear forever!



</answer>

<question from>



nak nak pondok
Member since: 11 March 2008
Total points: 59 (Level 1)



</question from>



<question>



What do you think???



Malingsia is a nickname that is suitable for all Malaysian people. It was derived from the word "Maling" and the word "Malaysia". In Bahasa Indonesia, "Maling" means "Thief" in English.



As we know, Malaysia is a country that like to steals other country's cultural heritage. Many Indonesian heritage, such as Traditional Folk Songs, Dances, Traditional Clothes and Music Instruments (i.e = Rasa Sayange Songs, Batik Clothes, Gamelan etc). Not only Indonesian tradition they stole, but they claimed that some Chinese Food was their heritage also. They think that because Malaysia consists of different races (chinese, indian, malay etc), that will automatically made every culture from those races are theirs also.



Remember the slogan of Malaysia Tourism Campaign: "Malaysia, Truly Asia". Because they claim that in Malaysia all of the culture of Asia exist, and therefore made them Truly Asia.



Malaysia people think that this insinuation should made other people visit only Malaysia to taste the whole Asia cultures, so there is no need to visit other countries in Asia. This, is a very contemptuous perception against all other countries in Asia.



If Truly Asia still is their tourism campaign, it really shows that Malaysia is never proud of their own heritage, but they preffered to advertise other countries heritage as their own. This, truly shows that Malaysia is, malingsia after all.



</question>

Trek M

<answer>



Goths typically don't go hunting for sympathy, or wear their sister's tight pants.  Goth is a much more laid back lifestyle then an emo's as emo's are always defending what they stand for where a goth just lives in the lifestyle and doesn't care how the world views them.  At some opportunites the Goth community might come to the surface and express that they aren't out to eat everyone's first born such as what happend a few years ago with Vampirefreaks.  Emo's are also typically only found in the younger generation where Goth's don't really ever grow out of their lifestyle.



If you want to explain it to your sister then tell her that a Goth doesn't cry or whine when someone's trying to pick on them.  They don't wear one large bang that covers their whole face, and though they celebrate death, they are not necessarily suicidal or even faking to be suicidal as is very commonly found in an emo.

<answer>



In certain areas, such as freedom of speech and freedom of religion, the US is not a very free nation.  The US is the only first world nation where the government routinely spies on its own citizens, all in the name of "protecting" them; and being a Muslim praying in an airport is enough to be taken off of a flight.



In other areas, however, we are freer than all other first world nations.  We have by far the laxest gun ownership laws of any first world nation, as well as some of the lowest taxation.  As for taxation, the fact that we are taxed less makes us freer taxwise, but on the other side of the coin means that we have a lower standard of living than most first world countries.



However, you can't bash these proud Americans too much.  Even though they are wrong in believing we are the freest nation, so what, You have to admire the fact that despite the imperfections in our nation, very few US citizens would be willing to give up their US citizenship even for a million dollars.  That really says something about our nation-it may not be perfect, but hey, it's home, and we're staying.



</answer>

And I imagine their problem isn't with the Arab's Glorious History (I assume you mean the advent of Islam, which is why I didn't put in parenthesis), it's with Arab's (not to mentions others') haram attitudes towards them.



</answer>

blue_153...

<answer>



Depends on where in the US you live. I have lived in Illinois were the population is prodominantly black in alot of areas and I did encounter racism there in prodominantly white areas. The town I lived in was Millstadt, a town ran by Elders from Germany. They would not allow the bus to stop in town because they didnt want black people coming there. Reason being, they assumed all blacks that rid the bus were drug addicts. They were also prejudice against anyone who wasnt from there because me and everyone I knew there that was from a different area (or state in my case) were highly mistreated (rumors, name calling, ect.). However, other places I went there, people of all races got along fine. Just that one stupid, Old German people ran town. I had moved there from Montana where I had never ecountered a racism problem in my 9 yrs. So yes, unfortunately, racsim is still as big of a problem as it was 50 yrs in some areas.



</answer>

<answer>



Black women aren't considered as attractive and appealing as other women by the mainstream, which is why black women are vanishing from the media.  If there is a call for a black woman in a movie, notice that she is usually very visibly mixed or very light-skinned, which I suppose makes her more appealing to the masses.



If a dark-skinned black girl is in a movie, she's usually the trash-talking, slutty, obnoxious character used to fit a token role.



Sad but true.



That being said, all groups endure their stereotypes by the media.



When was the last time an Asian male was the heartthrob in an American movie?



Society hands us roles and uses the media to achieve them for us.



</answer>

African Diaspora
Member since: 06 October 2008

</question from>



<question>



Black People and Africa?



!) Are you  proud of your Afircan roots?
if so why?



Or do you exaggerate your non African percentage and always have to say about it when called simply black.



Or
Are you ashamed of your African roots
If so why?



To me being proud of being African is not as in being proud of the continent but of your race and the African traits which make you hair facial and bodily features culture all that



Black people we are the most talked about and hated because .................envy?



</question>



<answer from>



niceOne
Member since: 04 October 2008
Total points: 59 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



hip hop



</answer>



<answer from>



Common Sense
Member since: 12 May 2006
Total points: 85580 (Level 7)



</answer from>



<answer>



Any loud noise in a calm background is noticed..
Any wave on calm waters is noticed..
Any bad smell in a room is noticed..
Any disruption to the norm is noticed..
Being noticed does not mean being envied..



</answer>



<answer from>



Shina
Member since: 05 August 2007
Total points: 9440 (Level 5)



</answer from>



<answer>



I don't really know much about my African heritage because I don't know what country, tribe, etc. my family comes from. However I am proud of the accomplishments Black people of the African Diaspora have had.



I don't exaggerate my non-African percentage. If anything, I downplay it because I don't have much of a connection to it. My mom's biracial, but was adopted by a Black family, so we just say we're Black.



I'm not ashamed of my African roots. I just want to learn more about them.  I've made friends with some Igbo and Yuroba in college as well as a girl from Ghana. From what I've learned, the cultures are beautiful.



As for my features, je les adore (I adore them). I don't chemically alter my hair and I &lt;3 my brown skin.



</answer>



<answer from>



Vanina
Member since: 27 September 2008
Total points: 136 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



I am proud of being an African and being black. I can't really find a reason why but all I know is that I'm proud of who I am and what God made me. As you said some caucasians envy us they can't show it so they change it into hate. Some of them do their hair like ours (braids) and some others have surgeries to have some of our body features. So why won't we be proud of being who we are when you know some people admire who you are?



</answer>

<question from>



BABLI
Member since: 06 October 2008
Total points: 90 (Level 1)



</question from>



<question>



How inter caste marriages effect bothe the couples and the family?



</question>



<answer from>



goin2col...
Member since: 08 March 2007
Total points: 5640 (Level 5)



</answer from>



<answer>



what does inter caste mean?



</answer>



<answer from>



prince47
Member since: 14 January 2006
Total points: 36455 (Level 7)



</answer from>



<answer>



traditional customs and ways of life to some extent will affect the couples and family.
it is more relavent in joint families; not much in nucler families.



</answer>



<answer from>



raindrop...
Member since: 28 June 2006
Total points: 6543 (Level 5)



</answer from>



<answer>



inter-caste or inter-culutural marriages have thier own pros and cons.



the advantageous side is that it is intermingling of two cultures and both the couple get to learn something entirely different then what they did all thier lives. you get to enjoy different foods, music, languages, customs and goto to different places as well. All in all its an experience worth living.



The flip side is that in nuclear families it does not matter, but in joint families, there is a whole lot of adjustment the girl has to under go, as she has to learn more things compared to adjustment in a normal marriage within the same cultural background.



I wud still say that the pros outweigh the cons. Last but not the least, mutual understanding, respect & trust always remain the foundations of a good marriage, and if they are maintained then there is no reason a marriage wud not work out



</answer>

<question from>

Member since: 08 February 2007
Total points: 187 (Level 1)



</question from>



<question>



"Class" not "race" policy?



I'm writing a paper on "class" not "race" in college admissions.  I think we should switch affirmative action to be based on class.  If we take into account where people went to school, who their parents are, where they lived, etc., we'd be helping those that need it, rather than those who don't need it but get help because of their skin color.  What do you think?  I found a couple good articles, but not many.  If you have any, please post the link.  Thanks!



http://seattletimes.nwsource.com/html/op...
http://www.kzoo.edu/index/20060216/rlc.h...
http://diverseeducation.com/artman/publi...
http://news-service.stanford.edu/news/20...



</question>



<additional details>



How can you base on aptitude only when kids don't have the resources that others do because of the school they go to?  They don't have the amount of textbooks or computers, etc. that more affluent schools have.



You're not discriminating against the middle class with this policy because they're already getting in to college.  It'd be ridding the rich kids that get in with their money, not their skills and accepting more poor with better skills.



</additional details>

<answer>



Racism will never "go away".  You can only change people's views if they WANT to change.



Some people who are really willing to be less ignorant try to diversify themselves (going to different countries to introduce themselves to different cultures, going to school in a very diverse city, etc.).



</answer>



<answer from>



Shiori_h...
Member since: 06 August 2008
Total points: 2404 (Level 3)



Contributing In:



Higher Education (University +)



</answer from>



<answer>



I think a lot of people fail to realize that there are two sides to the racism issue. There are the groups being oppressed/discriminated against (kind of depends on the situation and how you prefer to view it), and that's what most people focus on. This isn't a bad thing, of course -- we should do everything we can to educate people about discrimination and do everything we can to combat it. But what many people DON"T seem to realize -- or perhaps they realize it but don't know how to address it -- is the issue of privilege. If there's a group being discriminated against then there's another group in a position of privilege. I can't tell you the number of times I've had wonderfully open-minded, progressive, intelligent students of mine be absolutely shocked when that side of the racism issue is brought up. And of course, I think this is also the hardest side of the racism issue to fight because who wants to give up privileges, even ones they aren't consciously aware of? But I also think it's the most important because it has been neglected for so long.



If you haven't read it already, you should take a look at "Unpacking the Invisible Knapsack" by Peggy McIntosh (here: http://mmcisaac.faculty.asu.edu/emc598ge... )(there's also a version here if you want something with a neater list and also want to see how this article can be relevant for topics other than racism: http://www.lilithgallery.com/feminist/mo... ). Some parts of it are a little dated now -- she wrote it in the 1980s if I recall correctly -- but it's still very relevant and I have found it to be an excellent tool for pointing out and explaining this other side of the racism issue. I personally think that one of our strongest tools for fighting any kind of -ism, including racism, is a good education.



</answer>



<answer from>



Gr0undZe...
Member since: 04 October 2008
Total points: 111 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



http://answers.yahoo.com/question/index;...



</answer>



<answer from>



Dropshor...
Member since: 12 April 2007
Total points: 10096 (Level 6)



</answer from>



<answer>



Primitive tribal territorially scepticism and fear of invasion by outside forces leads to distrust among primitive societies. I am afraid it has been with the homo sapians ever since they jumped out of the trees and started to walk.



Ethnic intolerance has more to do with religious values than joining together in trade and prosperity instead of poverty.



When the Assyrians held power in the Middle East 3,000 years ago the encompassed different ethnic and religious bodies under one King rule. During this period wealth and expansion of population gained strength for one of the greatest nations of that particular time.



Rome failed due to the fact that to be a Roman you had to be born a Roman but outsourced their responsibilities to foreigners.



So what has today's generations of humans around the world from history. The answer is absolutely nothing we still live in a divided world of religious and social indifference's towards each other and until then nothing will really change as far as I am concerned.



Spain once had multicultural society with Jews, Muslims and Christians with a bit of paganism mixed in. The Catholics wanted to change this with the help of a diminishing royalist of Spain persecution started against the Jews followed by the genocide of the Muslims either through the inquisitions of military aggression.



Russia with its Communist control had a similar existences alas for the if you are not of pure Russian decent and Orthodox Catholic then you were exterminated or disposed of wealth land and citizenship.



So I conclude such as life on this planet of homo sapians or should I say Planet of the Apes. re the movie of that title.



</answer>

<question from>



ickarus_...

<question>



Wouldn't you guys be happy too if you could escape unreasonableness?



I lived in South Africa for the past 23 years. Blacks stole my lunch from me at school and still had the nerve to ask me for lunch during breaks. They'd talk about me in their language then laugh and I'd feel down. Just after the new South Africa formed, one guy tried terrorising me for being white and harming his people. I was 10 and how could I have harmed his people at that age? I started working recently and they'd always ask me very jumpy questions like why do you white people love bread so much as they preferred cooked food, and they'd ask me if I'd ever marry a black or date one. I resigned and I'm now leaving for South Korea on a venture out there. I resigned a few weeks ago and my director (who's a white guy said I can go with immediate effect) but my black manager said I must stay because I have work to do. I had nothing to do. I sat there like a doll just going out of my mind. She tried convincing me psychologically that I've got work and after sometime she made it known to me that she's jealous of me going after working for a few months and she can't after working for 10 years. I left last week (althought I still had to work this week out) and she was furious. I mean why are black people so unreasonable and why do they always want but are never willing to give? What did they or their forefathers ever give towards the international community since the dawn of time?



I'm not a racist but just brutally honest.



Thank you



P.S. I also think that they like using people and they're very abusive and love pretending in order to get stuff their way. People who give into them are people who don't have honour or heritage.



</question>

<question>



"Class" not "race" policy?



I'm writing a paper on "class" not "race" in college admissions.  I think we should switch affirmative action to be based on class.  If we take into account where people went to school, who their parents are, where they lived, etc., we'd be helping those that need it, rather than those who don't need it but get help because of their skin color.  What do you think?  I found a couple good articles, but not many.  If you have any, please post the link.  Thanks!



http://seattletimes.nwsource.com/html/op...
http://www.kzoo.edu/index/20060216/rlc.h...
http://diverseeducation.com/artman/publi...
http://news-service.stanford.edu/news/20...



</question>



<additional details>



How can you base on aptitude only when kids don't have the resources that others do because of the school they go to?  They don't have the amount of textbooks or computers, etc. that more affluent schools have.



You're not discriminating against the middle class with this policy because they're already getting in to college.  It'd be ridding the rich kids that get in with their money, not their skills and accepting more poor with better skills.



</additional details>



<answer from>



THINK
Member since: 18 March 2008
Total points: 4851 (Level 4)



</answer from>



<answer>



you would also be discriminating against the middle class.



College admissions should be based on aptitude only.



</answer>



<answer from>



Authentic Black American
Member since: 13 July 2008
Total points: 556 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



Ill play devil advocate..



My argument against this is that it shuts out minorites. Say a school only had 3 seats left and had a pool of 100 low income people..



95% of the people are white
5% of the people are black



A test is taken to see who is the most qualifed to get those seats. The average score of all white students is 80%. The average score for all the black students are 95% (in fact lets say 100% the black students scored 95%).



And lets only 20% of the white students achieved the score of 95%..Because of the sheer number of white students it would be virtually impossible for a black student to ever be admitted despite the fact that as a group the outperform the white students.



While the most qualifed people are chosen, minorities are put at an inherient disadvantage due to population size. Therefore we'd never be able to become law makers.



</answer>



<answer from>



Dropshor...
Member since: 12 April 2007
Total points: 10102 (Level 6)



</answer from>



<answer>



There is more poverty among any population than those few that have extreme wealth which in-turn contains power over the masses in general terms. Those who are held within the middle class of people generally follow the wealthy class of wanting to just like them to some degree.



The corporate ladder of achievement is riddled with class discrimination with the confines of the workplace and reflects into mainstream society trends within that catchment area of progress.



Albeit I am happy to be just poor and I will stay that way.



</answer>



<answer from>



Maha
Member since: 28 August 2008
Total points: 2354 (Level 3)



Contributing In:

</answer from>

<answer>



I don't know.. It's weird. My husband is black and he says he was never attracted to black girls. I always thought that was odd. But I'm extremely attracted to him.. so I'm not exactly complaining. Like, I never went for pretty white boys at all.. mainly because of a generalized conceitedness that intimidated me. Has nothing to do with their race, it's a way I want to be treated and loved. I went for the intellectual GI Joe with an amazing body :) I wouldn't count out an entire female or male race. Everyone is so different. But certain areas, upbringings, social groups, conform to certain personalities in a lot of cases. I have some female black friends that are really, really sweet.



I believe in one mate for life.. and out of so many people, having a specific type narrows down your search. The idea is to be happy and in love.. and it helps for them to have a personality that compliments your own, no matter the race or other factor.

LexDiamo...
Member since: 04 May 2008
Total points: 6428 (Level 5)



</answer from>



<answer>



Its because of society



Mixed-race blacks tend to fit in better with blacks than with whites. Almost EVERY black american has some white ancestry in them, whereas most white people dont have much significant black ancestry. For black people, being mixed-race isnt that much of a big deal becaus, like you yourself said, we all know mixed race people. Whereas in the white community, people mixed black-white arent as common and arent usually taken for white because they are 90% of the time darker than the average white person.



Think about it......we have light skinned blacks, but theres no such thing as dark-skinned white people.



</answer>

<answer>



This is a really good question. It depends as some mixed race people lean towards their white side & some lean to their black side or some remain in the middle.



If you grew up in more urban environments like Hackney, Mossside, Bristol etc then you find that they & including some white people fall more into the black culture, where as someone who has grew up in a more white environment may lean towards being more White. (whatever that means).



look at Obama & Tiger Woods for an example. Obama leans more towards being more black with a black wife & kids where as Tiger has adopted the white culture with his white wife & kids & lifestyle.



But remember everyone is an individual so they choose their own culture or lifestyle.

<question from>



Joe
Member since: 16 April 2008
Total points: 403 (Level 2)



</question from>



<question>



Where do white and black Mexicans fit into the "Brown Pride" movement?



Brown Pride is supposedly an organization to promote "Mexicanness" or whatever, but there are white and black Mexicans too!  Not all Mexicans are brown, so where do the non-brown Mexicans fit in?  Does this mean the members of Brown Pride are racist and believe if you're not brown, then you're not Mexican?  (Before anyone tells me otherwise, yes, there are black Mexicans; the United States isn't the only country that once had slavery, and there are still black Mexican populations along the Costa Chica in the states of Guerrero and Oaxaca).



</question>



</answer from>



<answer>



mexico is 1% black, so this hardly ever comes up as an issue. And black people are brown too.



As for everything else. The Brown Pride movement is more or less aimed at the mestizo & indio populations of mexican-americans, which make up about 90% of Mexico's people at home. White Mexican-Americans are even less prominent because the white population of mexico is overall much better off, so fewer whites have any reason to leave. White mexicans were never a large part of the mexican-american community, so the brown pride movement largely excluded them.



Also, White Mexicans have a history of discriminating against brown mexicans in the old country anyway.



</answer>

<question from>



muski27
Member since: 23 November 2006
Total points: 162 (Level 1)



</question from>



<question>



What is wrong in emulating other cultures?



All around the world you will see certain indivuals or ethnic groups emulating or immitating other ethnic groups. An example would be
Caucasians acting African American
Vice Versa
South Asians acting Black
Asians Acting white
the list could go on.



My question is what is wrong with that? Why are people condemned as try hards or ridiculed? Is it such a sin to have an open mind and appreciation of other people's culture? I certainly am open to a wide array of different cultures in terms of food, music and customs even though I may not understand the language!



</question>



<answer from>



bizzy
Member since: 05 September 2008
Total points: 445 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



no there is nothing wrong with that at all its just people's need to feel unique that makes people trip over dumb things like that.



</answer>



<answer from>



tyclgolv...
Member since: 17 October 2007
Total points: 1 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



i'm asian, and i don't act white.



</answer>



<answer from>



BabaluAy...
Member since: 01 September 2008
Total points: 913 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



Ethnic groups are often underpinned by a strong sense of unity.  This extends to sub-cultures too..And when someone recreates the mannerisms on which that unity is built without actually being part of it, Some groups see this as offensive. Sort of like walking around wearing a "J-Dilla changed my life" T-shirt when you don't know who J-Dilla.



There is nothing wrong, People enjoy feeling accepted. Acceptance and being embraced by a large culture is a nice feeling. If this is done insincerely...



To quote Cleveland on family guy "Maybe your son is copying the mannerisms of another culture because he doesn't know enough about his own."



Its not a sin. You're a try hard if you overdo it to the point where by you are visibly making a spectacle of yourself.



</answer>

<answer>



I think that some people do have deep rooted issues with their own ethnicity and deliberately seek out others who they see as different or sadly, even better themselves.  However, I believe they are in the minority.  I honestly believe that most times their reasons for dating interracially are pretty simple.  The other person probably just has the physical and personality traits they're attracted to.  We all like something different, that's all.  It's as basic as having a favorite food or color.  There's nothing wrong with pink, but I like orange more.  Asparagus is cool, but I'd rather have broccoli.  It's just a matter of personal preference. I think it's the same with dating.



</answer>
